generif.text: Candidate gene in the onset of hereditary infectious/inflammatory diseases.
TIR adaptor SARM is a negative regulator of Toll-like receptor signaling.
confirmed the co-localization of retinoschisin with Na/K ATPase and SARM1 in photoreceptors and bipolar cells of retina tissue
SARM1 deficiencies may uncover unexpected similarities between the ways in which neurons and immune cells sense and respond to danger.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
SARM-mediated inhibition may not be exclusively directed at TRIF or MyD88, but that SARM may also directly inhibit MAPK phosphorylation
Observational study of gene-disease association, gene-environment interaction, and pharmacogenomic / toxicogenomic. (HuGE Navigator)
Observational study of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)

The N-terminal 27 amino acids (S27) of SARM, which is hydrophobic and polybasic, acts as a mitochondria-targeting signal sequence, associating SARM to the mitochondria. The S27 peptide has an inherent ability to bind to lipids and mitochondria.
SARM overexpression caused mitochondrial clustering which has also been observed in several cell death phenomenon.
These results indicate that association of PINK1 with SARM1 and TRAF6 is an important step for mitophagy.
The innate immunity adaptor SARM translocates to the nucleus to stabilize lamins and prevent DNA fragmentation in response to pro-apoptotic signaling.
Data found that the UXT isoforms elicit dual opposing regulatory effects on SARM-induced apoptosis.
Rapid Wallerian degeneration requires the pro-degenerative molecules SARM1.

Data show that sterile alpha- and armadillo-motif-containing protein (SARM) modulates MyD88 protein-mediated Toll-like receptors (TLRs) activation through BB-loop dependent interleukin-1 receptor (TIR) TIR-TIR interactions.
Active nerve degeneration requires SARM1 and MAP kinases, including DLK, while the NAD+ synthetic enzyme NMNAT2 prevents degeneration.

we identify a physical interaction between the autoinhibitory N terminus and the TIR domain of SARM1, revealing a previously unrecognized direct connection between these domains that we propose mediates autoinhibition and activation upon injury.

SARM1 is phosphorylated at Ser-548 by c-jun-N-terminal kinase under conditions of oxidative stress, and this increases SARM1's NADase activity, leading to inhibited mitochondrial respiration and decreased levels of NAD+ and ATP.
These results highlight the importance of oligomerization for SARM1 function and reveal critical epitopes for future targeted drug development.
Vincristine and bortezomib use distinct upstream mechanisms to activate a common SARM1-dependent axon degeneration program.
The SARM1 axon degeneration pathway: control of the NAD(+) metabolome regulates axon survival in health and disease.
lncRNA OGFRP1 functions as a ceRNA to promote the progression of prostate cancer by regulating SARM1 level via miR-124-3p.
The NAD(+)-mediated self-inhibition mechanism of pro-neurodegenerative SARM1.
Structural basis for SARM1 inhibition and activation under energetic stress.
Multiple domain interfaces mediate SARM1 autoinhibition.
SARM1 is required in human derived sensory neurons for injury-induced and neurotoxic axon degeneration.
Expression of sterile-alpha and armadillo motif containing protein (SARM) in rheumatoid arthritis monocytes correlates with TLR2-induced IL-1beta and disease activity.
Sarm1-mediated neurodegeneration within the enteric nervous system protects against local inflammation of the colon.
Acidic pH irreversibly activates the signaling enzyme SARM1.
SARM1-mediated wallerian degeneration: A possible mechanism underlying organophosphorus-induced delayed neuropathy.
The curious case of SARM1: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde in cell death and immunity?
Enrichment of SARM1 alleles encoding variants with constitutively hyperactive NADase in patients with ALS and other motor nerve disorders.
Sarm1 activation produces cADPR to increase intra-axonal Ca++ and promote axon degeneration in PIPN.
Constitutively active SARM1 variants that induce neuropathy are enriched in ALS patients.
Circ_0044516 Enriches the Level of SARM1 as a miR-330-5p Sponge to Regulate Cell Malignant Behaviors and Tumorigenesis of Prostate Cancer.
SARM1 can be a potential therapeutic target for spinal cord injury.
TLR4 and SARM1 modulate survival and chemoresistance in an HPV-positive cervical cancer cell line.
Natural variants of human SARM1 cause both intrinsic and dominant loss-of-function influencing axon survival.
TIR-1/SARM1 inhibits axon regeneration and promotes axon degeneration.
A phase transition reduces the threshold for nicotinamide mononucleotide-based activation of SARM1, an NAD(P) hydrolase, to physiologically relevant levels.
The SARM1 TIR domain produces glycocyclic ADPR molecules as minor products.
Context-Specific Stress Causes Compartmentalized SARM1 Activation and Local Degeneration in Cortical Neurons.
Augustus Waller's foresight realized: SARM1 in peripheral neuropathies.

BP.term: negative regulation of MyD88-independent toll-like receptor signaling pathway

interpro.desc: Sterile alpha and TIR motif-containing protein 1

name: sterile alpha and TIR motif containing 1
other_names: sterile alpha and Armadillo repeat protein
sterile alpha and HEAT/Armadillo motif protein, ortholog of Drosophila
sterile alpha and TIR motif-containing protein 1

reactome.name: Activation of IRF3, IRF7 mediated by TBK1, IKKε (IKBKE)
IKK complex recruitment mediated by RIP1
TRAF6-mediated induction of TAK1 complex within TLR4 complex

wikipathways.name: Regulation of toll-like receptor signaling pathway

summary: Enables NAD+ nucleotidase, cyclic ADP-ribose generating and identical protein binding activity. Involved in NAD catabolic process; positive regulation of neuron death; and response to axon injury. Located in mitochondrion. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
